snippet: In a speech Sunday, President Bashar al-Assad repeated many of his earlier pledges to maintain a crackdown on opponents he described as terrorists aided by foreign governments.
abstract: Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad denies that his government played any role in the Houla massacre; says that the country's problems are rooted in terrorism rather than the lack of political change, and that dialogue with the the opposition remains impossible; blames foreign governments for aiding terrorists.

byline.contributor: Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: In a speech Sunday, President Bashar al-Assad repeated many of his earlier pledges to maintain a crackdown on opponents he described as terrorists aided by foreign governments.
